armour.name: Aquila Armour
armour.desc: Mk.7 Armour, the most numerous version in the arsenal of the Chapter.

armour.name: Corvus Armour
armour.desc: Mk.6 Armour, famed for excellent mobility and stealth capacity.

armour.name: Maximus Armour
armour.desc: Mk.4 Armour, widely regarded as the best powered armor among all existing Mark.

armour.name: Iron Armour
armour.desc: Mk.3 Armour, which sacrificed its mobility in exchange for even greater protection.

armour.name: Errant Armour
armour.desc: Mk.8 Armour, with better protection in comparison to the more modern mark.

armour.name: Artificer Armour
armour.desc: Customized armors made by the Chapter's Techmarines, these boast extreme protective power and capability.

weapon.name: Knife
weapon.desc: In the hand of demigods, even a humble knife can be deadly.

weapon.name: Bolter
weapon.desc: This trusty weapon is the default choice for an Astartes.

chassis.name: Rhino
chassis.desc: The Rhino chassis is the most common and likewise the most versatile.

chassis.name: Land Raider
chassis.desc: The Land Raider performs as Superheavy troops carrier, with the firepower of a heavy tank and ability to carry Terminators into battle.

vehicle_weapon.name: Twin-linked Heavy Bolters
vehicle_weapon.des: The default weapon loadout for a Razorback, this can lay down heavy fire upon enemy formations.

vehicle_weapon.name: Twin-linked Heavy Flamers
vehicle_weapon.des: Exclusive to the Blood Angels and their successors, its short range is mitigated by the destructive fire it spew forth.

vehicle_weapon.name: Twin-linked Multi Melta
vehicle_weapon.des: The prized melta weaponry can penetrate the thickest of armors, but needed to close in to launch their attack.
